trans-unit.source: Setting attributes for the database connection URL

seg-source.mrk: Setting attributes for the database connection URL

target.mrk: Setting attributes for the database connection URL

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> allows you to supply a list of attributes to its database connection URL, which is a JDBC feature.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> allows you to supply a list of attributes to its database connection URL, which is a JDBC feature.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> allows you to supply a list of attributes to its database connection URL, which is a JDBC feature.

trans-unit.source: You typically set attributes in a semicolon-separated list following the protocol and subprotocol (and, in some cases, the subsubprotocol). For information on how you set attributes, see <xref href="rrefjdbc10889.dita#rrefjdbc10889"></xref>. This section provides reference information only.

seg-source.mrk: You typically set attributes in a semicolon-separated list following the protocol and subprotocol (and, in some cases, the subsubprotocol).
For information on how you set attributes, see <xref href="rrefjdbc10889.dita#rrefjdbc10889"></xref>.
This section provides reference information only.

target.mrk: You typically set attributes in a semicolon-separated list following the protocol and subprotocol (and, in some cases, the subsubprotocol).
For information on how you set attributes, see <xref href="rrefjdbc10889.dita#rrefjdbc10889"></xref>.
This section provides reference information only.

trans-unit.source: The DriverManager.getConnection method can take both a connection URL and a Properties object as arguments. If you specify any attributes both on the connection URL and in a Properties object, the attributes on the connection URL override the attributes in the Properties object.

seg-source.mrk: The DriverManager.getConnection method can take both a connection URL and a Properties object as arguments.
If you specify any attributes both on the connection URL and in a Properties object, the attributes on the connection URL override the attributes in the Properties object.

target.mrk: The DriverManager.getConnection method can take both a connection URL and a Properties object as arguments.
If you specify any attributes both on the connection URL and in a Properties object, the attributes on the connection URL override the attributes in the Properties object.

trans-unit.source: Attributes are not parsed for correctness. If you pass in an incorrect attribute or corresponding value, it is simply ignored.

seg-source.mrk: Attributes are not parsed for correctness.
If you pass in an incorrect attribute or corresponding value, it is simply ignored.

target.mrk: Attributes are not parsed for correctness.
If you pass in an incorrect attribute or corresponding value, it is simply ignored.
